content.description: Stand start with your left hand on a sidepull and your right hand on a small crimp. Move straight up on small feet and small crimps.
content.location: This boulder is to the right of Austen's Block.

content.description:
To the right of the hard bulge, the boulder gets taller and has 3 good lines. Contrived as they are, why not fill your resume with more moves?

This line goes up the left arete from the obvious sit start with your hands staying on the arete the whole time.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Hard Bulge

.

content.description: Sit start, match on a slopey jug, and move up and left using heel hooks and a big dynamic move out left to the slopey arete with your left hand...if it was only taller and more moves!
content.location:
It is to the right of

Easier Fun Climb

.

content.description: Stand start with your left hand on the seam and your right hand on the lip. Move up and slightly left then straight up.
content.location:
It is to the left of

Nice Slab

.

content.description: Stand start, match your hands on the slopey lip, toss a heel, and mantel up.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Fun Climb

.

content.description: This is the last contrived line on this face of the boulder. Stand start, and use the right sidepulls to go up the boulder without using any face holds. It works on your laybacks, fighting barndoors, and well it's fun to do different moves.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Center Classic

.

content.description: Sit start, match on small crimps, move your right hand to a gaston and your left hand to a slopey arete, then reach up to undercling then the lip.
content.location: It is close by to the other boulders.

content.description: Stand start with your right hand on a large sidepull and your left hand on small crimp sidepull. Move your right hand up to good arete hold and your left hand to the top. As a contrived line as well, keep your feet in the center of the line in order to achieve the desired climb.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Left of Classic

.

content.description: Sit start, match on the ledge, and move up through very techy body positions with slopey hands and smears. This is a superb climb for how short it is.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Awkward Center

.

content.description: Sit start. Only a few moves on polished slopers are angled the wrong direction.
content.location: It is on the last boulder of the Brood.

content.description: Sit start, match on the edge, then move up and left to a very awkward mantwl. Then reach to the lip. It is a very unique and interesting move to stand up out of the mantel.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Awkward Left

.

content.description: Sit start, use compression, and then work up the arete all the way to the pinnacle of the boulder. You do know topping out early only cheats yourself.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Austen's Jump Start

.

content.description: Sit start on the far left of the boulder on the arete, match your hands on a jug on a slightly detached chunk of the boulder, move your right hand out to a slopey slidepull, make a dynamic move with your left hand to the lip, and mantel.
content.location: It is on the first large boulder you come to as you move south from the Fupa Boulder.

content.description: Stand start, step up your left foot on the detached chunk, and sky up to the lip.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Austen's Left Problem

.

content.description: Sit start, ride up the arete, and then make a big move with your left hand to a sloping edge out left. Utilize right heel hooks, lots of compression, and body tension. Watch out for the ass dab.
content.location:
It is to the right of

Classic Arete

or left of

Nice Slab

.

content.description: Sit start with your right hand on a slopey arete and your left hand on an undercling pinch. Move up to good, flat edges, and mantel.
content.location: It is close to the other boulders.

content.description: Sit start with your left hand on a slopey arete and your right hand on a slopey arete. Pull up, and slap to the lip.
content.location: It is close to the other boulders.
